newsitem.title: USA: Amylin buys compounds from Hoechst.
newsitem.headline: Amylin buys compounds from Hoechst.

text.p: Amylin Pharmaceuticals Inc said it acquired worldwide rights to a series of orally active compounds being evaluated for their ability to reduce risk factors of heart disease.
It said in preclinical models the compounds have been shown to inhibit formation of plaque in blood vessels by lowering cholesterol, acting as anti-oxidants and reducing inflammation.

Under terms of the agreement, Amylin is responsible for preclinical evaluation and clinical development of the compounds and Hoechst, upon completion of Phase II trials, will have a one-time right to enter a collaboration to continue developing the comound under a 50-50 cost and profit sharing arrangement.
